attributes.action: Reverse the Verdict/Sentence given to a young woman in NI for having an abortion
attributes.additional_details:
A horrifying story, which should have been long relegated to the annals of history, sadly still the reality for a woman living in Northern Ireland in 2016
convicted under ancient laws passed under Queen Victoria & sat untouched on Northern Ireland’s statute books for over 150 years. Regardless of Northern Ireland’s contested constitutional status, when it comes to human rights law we are just as much British citizens as women living in Blackpool or Birmingham. Westminster could easily overturn the abortion ban by passing legislation in the House of Commons. There is a particularly clear case for doing this as a High Court found in November that Northern Ireland’s abortion ban breaches international human rights law. 

Article by Siobhan Fenton The Independant
attributes.background: Today in the UK, a woman has been found guilty of having an abortion. The 21yr old was given a three month sentence, suspended for two years at Belfast high court

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government and Parliament does not have the power to reverse the verdict of the courts, which are independent of both Parliament and Government. 

If you would like the law to be changed, you might like to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/126665
